title: Cray Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Jonathan Billinger / Cray Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cray Reservoir. Viewed from the flank of Cefn Cul near Bwlch Bryn-rhudd.

images.caption: Tower southwest of Cray reservoir

description: Enjoy a walk along this peaceful reservoir in the Brecon Beacons. The lake is surrounded by some lovely lush countryside and woodland. It's purpose is to supply water to the towns in the valley of the River Tawe and north Swansea, but it also makes for a nice easy walk. You can park at the car park just off the A4067 Swansea Sennybridge road, on the eastern side of the water. Then pick up the footpaths heading north up to the dam with great views across the water and pretty waterfalls to see on the way. You can extend the walk by continuing north along the riverside paths of the River Crai which feeds the reservoir. Just to the west of the site you'll find two other lovely lakes in the shape of Llyn y Fan Fach and Llyn Y Fan Fawr. It's a very popular, isolated spot and a great place to continue your walking in the area. The Usk Reservoir is a few miles to the north on the other side of the Glasfynydd Forest.
